channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bank of America joins growing chorus on Wall Street loving this sector to play China's stimulus
item.description: Bank of America strategist Savita Subramanian upgraded the materials sector, which looks to offer at least two catalysts to spark a rally.

item.title: GM reports 2.2% decrease in third-quarter sales, but EVs make gains
item.description: The Detroit automaker reported a 2.2% drop in third-quarter sales compared to a year earlier to 659,601 vehicles sold.

item.title: Gen Z is breaking into the trade sector as college disillusionment rises
item.description: The youngest working generation looks to blue-collar jobs while prioritizing stability.

item.title: Bond ETFs on rise along with tensions in Middle East
U.S. economy is on the cusp of another Roaring ’20s, says UBS
item.description: "By early 2025 only the most pessimistic investors will need rose-colored glasses to see a clear path to a Roaring ’20s outcome," a UBS analyst says.

item.title: All stock-market sectors have lost ground Tuesday — except energy and utilities
Israeli forces launch ground offensive in Lebanon as markets fear escalation
item.description: Israel has launched a ground incursion into Lebanese territory, with markets on edge over the escalation in the conflict.

item.title: Intel’s struggles hit Biden’s Chips and Science Act with a gut punch
Nike reports earnings after the bell. Here's what Wall Street expects
item.description: Nike is in a reset after critics say it lost sight of innovation and ceded share to competitors. Its CEO, John Donahoe, is scheduled to step down this...

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Lockheed Martin, Paychex, CVS and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Apple is sharpest-declining Dow stock as analyst voices iPhone demand concern
US job openings rose in August, surprising economists
item.description: The Labor Department reported Tuesday that employers posted 8 million vacancies in August, up from 7.7 million in July.

item.title: Here’s the real reason 75% of corporate AI initiatives fail
item.description: 'Adding AI to a business model of the past doesn’t lead to competitiveness—it simply solidifies old processes,' writes the author of The Humanchine.

item.title: This alternative ETF keeps beating an increasingly tech-stocks-dependent S&P 500
Discover’s CIO says AI in financial services is still in the ‘early stages’ as the industry navigates 2 risks
item.description: Gen AI will eventually be a “very robust enabler” in financial services, says Jason Strle of Discover Financial Services.
